info.label: PhD Candidate at Bristol Robotics Lab
info.brief: Whilst completing my degree I developed a keen interest in mathematics, programming and robotics and became fascinated by how they form a common connection between humans and the surrounding world. I am now pursuing a PhD investigating methods for learning both data efficiently and safely onboard physical robotic systems. I am particularly interested in using probabilistic models for learning dynamics models and their integration into model-based reinforcement learning algorithms.

history.summary: Alongside my PhD studies I am a teaching assistant for the following courses:
highlights: Machine Learning COMS30007 - https://bit.ly/2C6UbKp
Robotic Systems COMSM0012 - https://bit.ly/2LV7rpZ
Intelligent Software Systems EMATM0042 - https://bit.ly/2Rn2mwx

history.summary: Researching methods for learning both data efficiently and safely onboard physical robotic systems. In particular, investigating learning probabilistic dynamics models to reduce the impact of model errors and their integration with control techniques to provide safety guarantees within a model-based reinforcement learning framework. EPSRC Centre for Doctoral Training in Future Autonomous and Robotic Systems (FARSCOPE).
highlights: Model-based reinforcement learning
Probabilistic Modelling
Bayesian inference
Optimal control
System identification
Developed teamwork skills, learning the importance of knowledge management within a team.
Overcame logistical issues and improved a system’s efficiency, resulting in the design’s approval.
Consistently met deadlines whilst working under pressure.
Conducted a feasibility study and estimated project costs that informed subsequent action.
Located an error and proposed a solution. Communicating this to relevant managers resulted in its successful implementation.
Mott MacDonald offered me future employment following my summer placement.

curriculum: Technology and Context of Robotics and Autonomous Systems - 67%
history.summary: Extending BDI Agents to Model and Reason with Uncertainty (77%) - https://github.com/aidanscannell/uncertain-agentspeak
Graduated in the top 10% of cohort.
I volunteer as a STEM ambassador, offering my time and enthusiasm through engagement with children both inside and outside of the classroom.
I collaborated with Code Club and Bristol Libraries to set up and run a Code Club for young people aged 9-13 at Junction 3 Library in Easton, Bristol.
Each year, as part of Formula Student, students design, build and race a single seat race car.
highlights: Finished 2nd in the National Class 2 competition in 2013/2014, I was then selected as the Drivetrain lead.
This role improved my communication skills as I was leading weekly presentations.
I developed my leadership skills through setting realistic objectives, effectively allocating work to the appropriate team members and monitoring outcomes.
Organised multiple weekly training sessions, demonstrating my ability to plan and run events smoothly.
Negotiated competitive prices for a growing member base within an inherently expensive sport.

Responsible for aiding the smooth running of the club and helping to organise the annual university ski trip, with circa 1500 participants, working under pressure to manage people in high stress situations.
Awarded the ‘Team of the Year’ award and full colours for my performances and contributions to the sport.

history.summary: Helping in the shop was rewarding and I developed my sales skills and an understanding of customer service.

recognition.title: British University Snowboard Slalom Champion
recognition.summary: In the 2017/2018 season I won all National British University Slalom Competitions. I have also podiumed in several British University SnowboardX and Slopestyle competitions.

recognition.title: Starting to Teach
recognition.summary: Acquired the knowledge and skills to establish myself as a confident, enthusiastic and effective teacherwho is able to engage, encourage and develop students' learning.

recognition.title: Full Sporting Colours
recognition.summary: Awarded full sporting colours for outstanding achievement in snowboarding.

recognition.title: Gold Crest Award
recognition.summary: Achieved through completion of the engineering education scheme.

recognition.title: Nissan Rose Bowl
recognition.summary: Awarded the Nissan Rose Bowl for the best team at the North Regional Assessment Day.
